subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Risk vs. Uncertainty: The Entrepreneur's Gamble
description: A fast breakdown of Risk vs. Uncertainty: The Entrepreneur's Gamble for builders.

buildup.text: Economists distinguish risk from uncertainty. Risk has known odds. Uncertainty has none.

discovery.text: Entrepreneurs thrive not by avoiding risk, but by operating where probabilities can't be calculated.

twist.text: Frank Knight proved this in 1921: profit exists only because uncertainty does. No fog, no fortune.

climax.text: Every startup pitch is a bet on the unknown. That's not recklessâ€”it's the nature of all new value.

punchline.text: Entrepreneurs don't gamble. They dance with the unknown.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between risk and uncertainty?
options: Risk has calculable odds; uncertainty does not
